info.title: Gene MCP Drug for Disease Translator API
info.description:
This API retrieves drugs associated with a given disease using the Model Context Protocol (MCP).
Example query: Find drugs associated with "drug-induced liver injury".

get.summary: Retrieve diseases associated with a given disease
get.description:
Returns a list of diseases (subjects) that are associated with a specified disease (object).
The relationships between disease and diseases are annotated using Biolink model terms.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description:
The disease name or condition for which to find associated tissue associations.
Example: "Type 2 Diabetes".

subject.description: Information about the diseases associated with the disease.

id.description: Compact identifier (CURIE) for the disease entity.

object.description: Information about the disease being impacted.

id.description: Compact identifier (CURIE) for the disease entity.

relationship.description: Biolink model relationship between the tissue and the disease.

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve tissues associated with a given disease
get.description:
Returns a list of tissues (subjects) that are associated with a specified disease (object).
The relationships between tissues and diseases are annotated using Biolink model terms.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description:
The disease name or condition for which to find associated tissue associations.
Example: "Type 2 Diabetes".

subject.description: Information about the tissues associated with the disease.

id.description: Compact identifier (CURIE) for the tissue entity.

object.description: Information about the disease being impacted.

id.description: Compact identifier (CURIE) for the disease entity.

name.example: tenosynovial giant cell tumor, diffuse type

relationship.description: Biolink model relationship between the tissue and the disease.

level.description: A qualitative value of the level recorded for the association

reliability.description: A qualitative value of the confidence of the association

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve genes associated with a given tissue
get.description:
Returns a list of genes (subjects) that are associated with a specified tissue (object).
The relationships between genes and tissue are annotated using Biolink model terms.

The tissue name or condition for which to find associated gene associations.
Example: "adipocytes in adipose tissue".

object.description: Information about the tissues associated with the gene.

id.description: Compact identifier (CURIE) for the tissue entity.

subject.description: Information about the gene being impacted.

id.description: Compact identifier (CURIE) for the gene entity.

relationship.description: Biolink model relationship between the gene and the tissue.

level.description: A qualitative value of the level recorded for the association

reliability.description: A qualitative value of the confidence of the association

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve gene associated with a given disease
get.description:
Returns a list of genes (subjects) that are associated with a specified disease (object).
The relationships between genes and diseases are annotated using Biolink model terms.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description:
The disease name or condition for which to find associated genes.
Example: "drug-induced liver injury".

subject.description: Information about the gene associated with the disease.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the gene entity.
Typically a NCBIGene identifier.

object.description: Information about the disease or phenotype associated.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the disease entity.
Typically a MONDO ontology identifier.

relationship.description:
Biolink model relationship describing the connection between the gene and the disease.
Example: "biolink:gene_associated_with_condition" indicates that the gene is genetically associated with the disease.

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers (PMIDs) providing evidence for the relationship.

items.description: PubMed ID for a scientific publication.

score.description:
The computed score between 0 and 1 that reflects the strength of association between the gene and disease
Example: 0.875909686 indicates that the gene is strongly genetically associated with the disease.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve disease associated with a given gene
get.description:
Returns a list of diseases (subjects) that are associated with a specified gene (object).
The relationships between diseases and genes are annotated using Biolink model terms.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description:
The gene name or condition for which to find associated diseases.
Example: "PPARG".

object.description: Information about the gene associated with the disease.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the gene entity.
Typically a NCBIGene identifier.

subject.description: Information about the disease or phenotype associated.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the disease entity.
Typically a MONDO ontology identifier.

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers (PMIDs) providing evidence for the relationship.

items.description: PubMed ID for a scientific publication.

score.description:
The computed score between 0 and 1 that reflects the strength of association between the disease and gene
Example: 0.875909686 indicates that the gene is strongly genetically associated with the disease.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve biological process pathway associated with a given disease
get.description:
Returns a list of biological processes (subjects) that are associated with a specified disease (object).
The relationships between biological processes and diseases are annotated using Biolink model terms.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description:
The disease name or condition for which to find associated biological processes.
Example: "drug-induced liver injury".

200.description: Successful response with biological process-disease associations.

result.description: List of biological process to disease association records.

subject.description: Information about the biological process associated with the disease.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the biological process entity.
Typically a GO identifier.

name.description: Common name of the biological process.
name.example: Gomf - G Protein Coupled Chemoattractant Receptor Activity

object.description: Information about the disease or phenotype associated.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the disease entity.
Typically a MONDO ontology identifier.

relationship.description:
Biolink model relationship describing the connection between the biological process and the disease.
Example: "biolink:genetic_association" indicates that the biological process is genetically associated with the disease.

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers (PMIDs) providing evidence for the relationship.

items.description: PubMed ID for a scientific publication.

p-value.description:
A statistical measure computed by the Magma calculation that helps determine the strength of evidence against a null hypothesis
Example: 0.0005 indicates that the biological process is strongly genetically associated with the disease.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve disease associated with a given biological process pathway
get.description:
Returns a list of diseases (subjects) that are associated with a specified biological process (object).
The relationships between disease and biological process are annotated using Biolink model terms.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description:
The biological process pathway for which to find associated diseases.
Example: "Mhc Protein Complex Binding".

200.description: Successful response with disease-biological process associations.

result.description: List of biological process to disease association records.

object.description: Information about the biological process associated with the disease.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the biological process entity.
Typically a GO identifier.

name.description: Common name of the biological process.
name.example: Gomf - G Protein Coupled Chemoattractant Receptor Activity

subject.description: Information about the disease or phenotype associated.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the disease entity.
Typically a MONDO ontology identifier.

relationship.description:
Biolink model relationship describing the connection between the disease and the biological process.
Example: "biolink:genetic_association" indicates that the biological process is genetically associated with the disease.

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers (PMIDs) providing evidence for the relationship.

items.description: PubMed ID for a scientific publication.

p-value.description:
A statistical measure computed by the Magma calculation that helps determine the strength of evidence against a null hypothesis
Example: 0.0005 indicates that the biological process is strongly genetically associated with the disease.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve drugs associated with a given gene
get.description:
Returns a list of drug compounds (subjects) that are associated with a specified gene (object).
The relationships between drugs and genes are annotated using Biolink model terms.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description:
The gene name for which to find associated drug associations.
Example: "PPARG".

subject.description: Information about the drug compound associated with the gene.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the drug entity.
Typically a CHEBI identifier.

name.description: Common name of the drug compound.

object.description: Information about the gene being impacted.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the gene entity.
Typically a NCBIGene ontology identifier.

relationship.description:
Biolink model relationship describing the connection between the drug and the gene.
Example: "biolink:affects" indicates that the drug affects the gene.

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers (PMIDs) providing evidence for the relationship.

items.description: PubMed ID for a scientific publication.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve genes affected by a drug
get.description:
Returns a list of genes (subjects) that are associated with a specified drug compound (object).
The relationships between genes and drugs are annotated using Biolink model terms.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description:
The drug compound name for which to find the gene affected
Example: "imiquimod".

object.description: Information about the drug compound associated with the gene.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the drug entity.
Typically a CHEBI identifier.

name.description: Common name of the drug compound.

subject.description: Information about the gene being impacted.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the disease entity.
Typically a NCBIGene ontology identifier.

relationship.description:
Biolink model relationship describing the connection between the gene and the drug.
Example: "biolink:affected" indicates that the gene is affected by the drug.

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers (PMIDs) providing evidence for the relationship.

items.description: PubMed ID for a scientific publication.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve drugs associated with a given disease
get.description:
Returns a list of drug compounds (subjects) that are associated with a specified disease (object).
The relationships between drugs and diseases are annotated using Biolink model terms.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description:
The disease name or condition for which to find associated drug treatments.
Example: "drug-induced liver injury".

subject.description: Information about the drug compound associated with the disease.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the drug entity.
Typically a CHEBI identifier.

name.description: Common name of the drug compound.

object.description: Information about the disease or phenotype being treated.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the disease entity.
Typically a MONDO ontology identifier.

relationship.description:
Biolink model relationship describing the connection between the drug and the disease.
Example: "biolink:treats" indicates that the drug treats the disease.

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers (PMIDs) providing evidence for the relationship.

items.description: PubMed ID for a scientific publication.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve diseases associated with a given drug
get.description:
Returns a list of diseases (subjects) that are associated with a specified drug compound (object).
The relationships between diseases and drug compounds are annotated using Biolink model terms.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description:
The drug compound name or condition for which to find associated drug treatments.
Example: "boron".

object.description: Information about the drug compound associated with the disease.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the drug entity.
Typically a CHEBI identifier.

name.description: Common name of the drug compound.

subject.description: Information about the disease or phenotype being treated.

id.description:
Compact identifier (CURIE) for the disease entity.
Typically a MONDO ontology identifier.

relationship.description:
Biolink model relationship describing the connection between the disease and the drug.
Example: "biolink:treated" indicates that the disease is treated by the drug compound.

pubmed_ids.description: List of supporting PubMed article identifiers (PMIDs) providing evidence for the relationship.

items.description: PubMed ID for a scientific publication.

400.description: Invalid input parameter. Ensure the "input" query parameter is provided and correctly formatted.

500.description: Internal server error. Indicates a problem with processing the request.

Subject.description: Drug compound information (subject of the association).

id.description: Compact identifier (CHEBI CURIE) for the drug.

Object.description: Disease or phenotype information (object of the association).

id.description: Compact identifier (MONDO CURIE) for the disease.

name.description: Name of the disease or phenotype.

relationship.description: Biolink relationship between the drug and the disease.

pubmed_ids.description: List of PubMed IDs supporting the relationship.
